entry.title: Re: Guidelines for content created with generative AI
entry.content: I will add a simple rule of thumb: If you don’t have an answer to a particular question, you can ask GenAI to give you a hint or a direction to explore. However, all the GenAI generated hints need to be verified in the system for its accuracy before posting as an answer. Otherwise, don’t use the GenAI generated content especially when you are not a subject-matter-expert to judge it.

entry.title: Re: Solution manager Charm 7.2 on premise integration wit...
entry.content:
Hi there,

You can indeed go for an add-on / custom connector from 3rd party vendors as suggested.

The alternative, since there is no standard API for change management is by writing custom code. In short, you can write ABAP classes and expose them as a web service in order to handle interfacing that way. Ideally, you get a developer who has some CRM knowledge - since SAP Solution Manager's CHARM is build on top of a SAP CRM component. With the right developer, you can code what you want to have there in terms of being able to interface with 3rd party products.

Best regards

Tom

entry.title: Re: Is it possible to have value help for custom field ba...
entry.content:
Hello @P00019191 

In addition to your question

How the authorisation check is maintained for a CDS-based code list (Public Cloud)

Create or choose a value-help CDS that includes the auth field, such as Company Code / BUKRS. Bind it to your custom field as “Code list based on CDS view” and ensure it respects authorisation access protection through its primary source, SAP Support Portal-3612451 - Custom Fields - Frequently Asked Questions - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

In Maintain Business Roles (Fiori app), Configure the role’s Read/Value Help access to Restricted and specify the permitted Company Codes. During runtime, these role restrictions limit the CDS value help, ensuring users only see values for the company codes they are authorised for. SAP Help Portal-Identity and Access Management-Maintain Business Roles

KBAs (brief summaries):

KBA 3612451 – Custom Fields – FAQ: Confirms the setup for Code list based on CDS view, including how to select the correct value-help view; static code lists do not support authorisation-based filtering.

KBA 2733842 – Business Role restrictions UI: Demonstrates how to switch Write/Read/Value Help to Restricted and retain values—this is where the filter for the value help is applied. SAP Support Portal-2733842 - Business Role has No Access for Restriction Areas that are Not Maintained - SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP Developer News October 9th, 2025
entry.content:
DESCRIPTION 

PODCAST: https://podcast.opensap.info/sap-developers/2025/10/09/sap-developer-news-october-9th-2025/

Devtoberfest Week 3

CAP Customer Roundtable 15 Oct 2025 

  • All details including agenda: https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/sap-cloud-application-programming-model-cap-customer-roundtable-october/ba-p/14222428   

Scavenger Hunt Clue #7 

  • Scavenger Hunt Main blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/fun-for-week-1-the-devtoberfest-scavenger-hunt/ba-p/14183972 
  • Discovery Center: https://discovery-center.cloud.sap/index.html 
  • Architecture Center: https://architecture.learning.sap.com/  
  • Week 3 Puzzles blog post: https://community.sap.com/t5/devtoberfest-blog-posts/fun- for-week-3-puzzles-puzzles-puzzles/ba-p/14234936 
  • Links to the 4 Puzzles:  

https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-sap-crossword.html 

https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-sap-crossword-bonus.html 

https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-fun-scramble-codejam.html 

https://developers.sap.com/tutorials/devtoberfest2025-fun-scramble-languages.html 

 

CHAPTER TITLES  

0:00 Intro 

0:10 Devtoberfest Week 3 

0:51 ES5 Decommissioned 

1:29 CAP Customer Roundtable 15 Oct 2025 

2:09 Scavenger Hunt Clue #7 

 

TRANSCRIPTION

[Intro] This is the SAP Developer News for October 9th, 2025.

[Mamikee] Hi, everyone. Can you believe we're already wrapping up week two of Devtoberfest? It's been such a fun week, tons of coding, learning, and connecting with the community. But don't slow down just yet because week three is right around the corner and we've gotten some really exciting stuff planned. So if you want to find out what's coming up next, the challenges, the sessions, all the surprises, make sure to head over to the Devtoberfest group on communities.sap. This is where you'll find all updates on all the sessions that's going on. Check it out and keep earning your points. We'll see you in week three.

[Rainey] Howdy, SAP developers. If you're a user of the SAP developer tutorial system, there's an important migration that's been underway that you'll want to know about. We've been gradually migrating content from an older NetWeaver system called ES5 over to S/4HANA. And we're happy to say that that migration is largely complete today. As one of the final touches in this, Andre Fisher, a product manager for ABAP, has published a blog post outlining the decommissioning of the older system. You can click on a link below and get access to that information. Happy S4ing, folks.

[DJ] On Wednesday next week that's Wednesday the 15th of October 5pm CEST is the next installment of the CAP roundtable so it's on the horizon so I did that if you are a CAP aficionado a user a developer anybody involved in the CAP ecosphere this meeting is for you topics to discuss requirements, things to highlight, insights you want to share, then join this roundtable next Wednesday, 15th of October. See you there.

[Shrini] Hello, everybody. Are you ready for today's scavenger and clue? Today's clue is hidden right here in the Discovery Center. The SAP Discovery Center is packed with a lot of useful resources. You will find a mission catalog with missions to help you implement your use cases on SAP BTP. A guidance framework which gives you a clear and structured path with best practices and developer guide. Plus a service catalog for SAP BTP and AI services where you can check pricing, see available regions and explore the related missions. here is what to look for. In the Mission Catalog, search for the mission title, Setup Joule Studio with SAP Built in BTP Enterprise account. Once you open this mission, you will find the first three hexadecimal numbers of the clue. The next half of the clue can be found in the Architecture Center. Architecture Center was recently launched by SAP to showcase, share, and collaborate on reference solution architectures with the developers and architects. It has a sleek card style overview page. Head over to the tile named Exchange Joule with Joule's Toolbook. Once you land on the page, you might notice something out of place there. The next three hexadecimal numbers might be hiding there. As a part of fun activities for week 3, we have 4 brand new puzzles. Check it out in this blog post by Daniel. You can find links to all the resources in the description. Let us know about your hunt in the comments.

entry.title: Understanding SAP SuccessFactors Transport Center
entry.content:
In the dynamic world of HR digital transformation, change is constant — whether it’s implementing new features, updating business rules, or refining workflows. As organizations scale their SAP SuccessFactors environments across multiple modules and geographies, transporting configurations between environments becomes both a necessity and a challenge.

This is where SAP SuccessFactors Transport Center plays a pivotal role.

What is SAP SuccessFactors Transport Center?

SAP SuccessFactors Transport Center is a pivotal tool designed to streamline the management and deployment of configurations across various environments within the SAP SuccessFactors suite. It facilitates the efficient transfer of data and settings, ensuring consistency and accuracy in system configurations. By leveraging this tool, organisations can enhance their operational efficiency, reduce the risk of errors, and maintain a seamless workflow across different stages of development and production.

Key Features:

• Centralized Management: Manage and monitor all transport activities from one place. Assign permissions to control who can create, approve, and deploy transports.
• Role-Based Access: Ensure that only authorized users can perform specific actions. Supports segregation of duties for compliance.
• Bundle Configurations: Group multiple related artifacts into a single transport bundle for consistency and ease of deployment.
• Audit Trail & Version Control: Track what was moved, when, by whom, and from which system to which.
• Pre-Check & Validation: Validates objects before deployment to prevent dependency errors or missing references.

How Transport Center Works:

Transport Center follows a structured transport lifecycle:

1. Create Transport Bundle
2. Review & Approve
3. Deploy
4. Monitor

What Can You Transport?

Transport Center supports configurations for:

- Employee Central: Business rules, Workflows, Picklists, Foundation objects
- Performance and Goals: Templates, Route maps
- Recruiting: Configuration objects (limited)
- Compensation: Plan templates (limited support)
- Generic Objects

Note: Some modules may still require manual transport or legacy methods.

Security and Governance:

Transport Center ensures compliance with change management standards through:
- Change history logs
- User-based approval flows
- Role-Based Permissions (RBP)
- Alerts and notifications

Benefits of Using Transport Center:

• Consistency: Reduces human errors caused by manual methods
• Compliance: Aligns with audit requirements
• Speed: Faster deployments
• Collaboration: Streamlines team workflows
• Error Prevention: Reduces risks with validations

Best Practices for Using Transport Center:

1. Use meaningful naming conventions
2. Test in lower environments first
3. Use role-based permissions
4. Schedule deployments during off-hours
5. Monitor logs post-deployment

What’s Next?

SAP plans to expand the Transport Center with:
- Wider module support
- Enhanced reporting
- Integration with SAP Cloud ALM and Solution Manager

Final Thoughts

As organizations evolve their SAP SuccessFactors landscapes, Transport Center becomes a must-have tool for reliable configuration movement. It's not just about moving data — it’s about governing change and enabling faster innovation cycles.

entry.title: 🤬 SAP Public Cloud: It's not a Bug, it's a feature not yet localized
entry.content:
Recently, SAP Support has started using a new phrase... "It's not a Bug, it's a feature not yet localized for xxx Country"

2 different instances that I faced recently:

  • RAP BO: I_BILLINGDOCUMENTTP Action CreateFromExternalData
    • Issue: Dump happens during Save phase
    • Reason: For Brazil, there are some mandatory field checks coded within the Billing Document Save that throws Messages, which RAP engine doesn't like, and thus results in a BEHAVIOR_ILLEGAL_STATEMENT dump.
    • Response: ......The localization of the 1Z6 scope item was carried out using the API with SOAP, and this process does not involve the I_BillingDocumentTP Business Object.....
  • RAP BO: I_PURCHASEORDERTP_2 Action Create
    • Issue: Delivery Address passed in the RAP BO by calling program, isn't considered for Tax calculation
    • Reason: The bug is identified in Class CL_TXS_FM_ADDRESS, method GET_ADDRESS_COMPLETE. The class is passing both address number & address handle to the function module ADDR_GET_COMPLETE, and this results in a Parameter_error Exception. The exception is happening because both parameters contain value. If address handle is populated, then only address handle must be passed to the function. If address handle is not populated, only then pass the address number. This requires a simple fix. A simple IF condition before the Function module call will avoid the Parameter_Error exception.
    • Response: ....However, since you are using a Z class for the creation of the Purchase Order, we cannot guarantee that the process will work properly, as the document creation flow is different. This also happens when using some Fiori Apps, such as Manage Purchase Order, for example....... I would like to emphasize that this is not a SAP bug, but rather a scenario that is not localized for Brazil, since in these contexts we are directly consuming an MM Core logic. If you use the localized VH Create Purchase Order - Advanced (ME21N), you won't face any issues.......

It is incredibly painful to get together enough people to vote on a request for a new API on Influence portal, since everyone who are working with Public Cloud, may not face the same requirement at the same exact time. And, until they face the issue, they may not bother to come to Influence portal and search for the request and vote on it. Even if we do all that, and gather enough votes and gather SAP's attention to put in a development request for the API, what I hear now is released APIs are still not to be trusted, because they may not be localized for a specific country or a specific scenario and it takes another Influence ticket in Localization Influence Portal, and the same chain of processes, for it to become useful.

What does released API even mean? Where on API hub is the documentation/list of localized APIs?

entry.title: Re: API Consumption from S4 Hana Cloud Public Edition to...
entry.content:
Hello @LeonardoGarcia2 ,

The error is usually one of these:

1. Missing API version in the Service Root
In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the A2X OData V2 services are versioned. Include the version suffix in PaPM:

Product: /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_PRODUCT_SRV;v=0002/ (entity set A_Product)

Business Partner: /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_BUSINESS_PARTNER;v=0002/ (entity set A_BusinessPartner)
SAP Help documents the v=000x convention for OData V2 services. SAP Help Portal-APIs on SAP Business Accelerator Hub

2.Destination authentication
When transitioning from BTP/PaPM to S/4HANA Cloud, use OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion instead of Basic authentication, referencing your S/4 Communication Arrangement details. SAP’s documentation recommends OAuth2SAML as the preferred configuration for S/4HANA Cloud destinations. SAP Help Portal-SAP S/4HANA Cloud

How could you fix it?

In BTP → Destinations → Check Connection, call the service root with $metadata ( /sap/opu/odata/sap/API_PRODUCT_SRV;v=0002/$metadata).

404 → wrong path (usually missing; v=0002).

401/403 → auth/role/scopes (switch to OAuth2SAML or fix the comm. arrangement/roles).

200 + EDMX → destination is good; re-run in PaPM. (PaPM connection doc is here.) SAP Help Portal-Application Help for Universal Model-Manage Connections

Regarding “get all data at once”:
set a higher Maximum page size (for example, 1000). S/4 will continue paginating large results using @odata.nextLink; PaPM automatically follows this link, so manual looping isn’t necessary. The general paging behaviour aligns with standard OData V2; details for Product/Business Partner API pages are provided here. SAP Help Portal-APIs for Master Data Maintenance-Business Partner (A2X) – OData API

Let me know if you need further support

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: HSN/SAC CODE FIELD MISSING IN CREATE SUPPLIER INVOICE...
entry.content:
Hello @RAHULSOMANI 

1) Maintain HSN/SAC at G/L account?

In Public Cloud, you do NOT maintain HSN/SAC on the G/L account. The HSN/SAC is used for GST determination on a material (HSN) or service master (SAC); you also maintain the tax-code mapping against HSN/SAC in configuration. SAP Help Portal-Defining Control Codes for Harmonized System Nomenclature (HSN)

What you should do

Maintain the code within Material/Service Master (India localisation fields).  SAP KBA 2430349 - GST India: Maintenance of HSN/SAC Codes KBA 2430349 – “GST India: Maintenance of HSN/SAC Codes” — FAQ on the HSN/SAC value help and master-data prerequisites (useful if your F4 list is empty or validation errors appear

In the configuration, ensure that the Tax Type/Tax Code is linked to HSN/SAC so that tax can be calculated accordingly and posted. SAP Help Portal-Maintaining Tax Type and Tax Code against HSN_SAC/Material

2) Is the HSN/SAC editable on a non-PO supplier invoice line?In Create/Manage Supplier Invoices for an IN-company code, you can enter or override the HSN/SAC field at the item level if it's not derived from a master. Refer to India-specific steps in the Supplier Invoice app help. SAP Help Portal-Create Supplier Invoice

SAP Help: Useful documentation

Maintain a combination of Tax Type and Tax Code against HSN/SAC/Material — explains the HSN/SAC-to-tax mapping used during posting. SAP Help Portal-Maintaining Tax Type and Tax Code against HSN_SAC/Material

Material/Service Master – link to HSN/SAC — shows where to keep HSN/SAC in masters for India localization. SAP Help Portal/Defining Control Codes for Harmonized System Nomenclature (HSN)

Create Supplier Invoice (India) — confirms India fields on the invoice (line-level entry/override). SAP Help Portal-Create Supplier Invoice

entry.title: MRP Transfer Requirement Not Defaulting Source Storage Location
entry.content:
Description:

We are trying to enable automatic stock transfers between two storage locations within the same plant via MRP in SAP ECC.

  • Scenario:
    We have two storage locations: Sloc A (source) and Sloc B (destination) within the same plant.
    Sloc B is maintained in the material master (MRP 4 view) with the "Storage Location MRP Indicator = 2 (Plan separately)".

  • Issue:
    When there is demand in Sloc B, MRP correctly generates a transfer requirement with movement type 311. However, the source storage location (Sloc A) is not populated in the transfer requirement. This requires manual intervention, which we want to avoid.

  • Expected Behaviour:
    We expect MRP to automatically populate Sloc A as the source storage location in the transfer requirement whenever there is demand in Sloc B.

  • Request:
    Please advise on the configuration or master data setup required to ensure that the source storage location (Sloc A) is automatically filled in the transfer requirement created by MRP.

entry.title: Re: Can I Skip a SAP SuccessFactors Stay Current Assessme...
entry.content:
Hello
My name is Raquel Souza
I'm from Brazil 🇧🇷  and I'll try to help you with your question.

Official Information Found

  1. SAP “Stay Certified / Stay Current” Policy

    • As of April 2024, all SAP certifications must be renewed annually through mandatory “stay certified” or “stay current” assessments to remain valid.
      (learning.sap.com – Certification Transformation)

    • According to the How to Stay Certified SAP page, you must complete the assessment before your “stay certified due” date to extend your certification for another 12 months.

    • If you do not complete the assessment by the due date, your certification will be marked as expired.
      (learning.sap.com – How to Stay Certified)

    • The official Certification Retirements FAQ states:

      “If you do not complete the stay certified assessment before the expiry date, you will no longer be certified. To regain certification, you must complete a full SAP Certification exam.”
      (learning.sap.com – Certification Retirements)

    ✅ In short: skipping a “stay current” assessment before its due date causes the certification to expire.

    Certification Retirement Rules

    • When SAP officially retires a certification, anyone holding an active certification at that time may automatically receive an additional 12 months of validity, without taking a new assessment.

    • However, this applies only when the certification is retired by SAP — it does not mean you can skip regular assessments at will.
      (learning.sap.com – Certification Retirements)

      Insights from SAP Community

      • In a discussion on SAP Community, users asked the same question about skipping one “stay current” assessment for SAP SuccessFactors (for example, skipping the 2H/2025 assessment and taking the next one before August 2026).
        The consensus: you cannot skip one without risking expiration. You must complete all required assessments in sequence to maintain your certification status.
        (SAP Community Discussion)

      • Additionally, SuccessFactors certifications use semiannual delta assessments (2H and 1H updates), meaning assessments are typically required every six months to remain current.
        (ERP Wizard article)

        ⚖️ Conclusion (with caution)

        Based on SAP’s official documentation and user experience:

        • You must complete each stay certified / stay current assessment before its due date to keep your certification valid.

        • If you skip one, your certification will be considered expired, and you will need to retake the full certification exam to regain it.

        • There is no official provision allowing you to skip one assessment (e.g., 2H/2025) and then take only the next (1H/2026) before expiry.

        • The only case in which you might automatically get an extension is if your certification is officially retired by SAP while it’s still valid.

          Recommendation

          If your certification (SAP SuccessFactors 8X, valid until August 2026) is under this rule:

          1. Check your SAP Learning Hub / My Learning profile for the “stay certified due date.”

          2. Contact SAP Certification Support directly to confirm if skipping one cycle is possible for your specific certification type.

          3. Request a written confirmation (email or support case response) to keep a formal record.
            I hope this helps. 😉

entry.title: Re: Restrict users from editing a parked invoice
entry.content:
Hello @ornecogli,

The recommended approach is to control app access (read versus write) through business roles and/or utilise Flexible Workflow for posting approvals.

SAP KBA 2598733 explains setting restrictions in roles, covering Read/Write/Value Help and restriction types. It is the main reference for role restrictions, noting no 'Invoice Status” restriction for supplier invoices. SAP Support Portal-KBA-2598733 - Maintain Restrictions in Business Role

SAP Help – Supplier Invoices (Fiori app). Describes that parked invoices are saved without posting and remain editable—hence why you must control write-capable apps or use workflow, rather than a status-only restriction.

SAP Help: Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices outlines the process for requiring approval prior to posting (including parked-as-complete status), which is SAP’s recommended control method when allowing users to park or view invoices without granting posting permissions.https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_S4HANA_CLOUD/0e602d466b99490187fcbb30d1dc897c/ff92035b3da94a14a3d2d0faffad564c.html

KBA 2598733 Maintain Restrictions in Business Role explains which elements can be restricted within roles, such as Read/Write/Value Help and restriction fields. There is no default restriction for "Invoice Status is equal Parked"; instead, access should be managed through app or catalogue assignment and write permissions. SAP KBA-2598733 - Maintain Restrictions in Business Role

If your client refuses to use workflow, an alternative is role design: assign “park-only” users the park/display apps, set Write = No Access on Manage Supplier Invoices to prevent editing or posting, and keep Read access as necessary. This approach is detailed in the role restrictions documentation above. SAP Learning-Maintaining Business Role Restrictions

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Printing of HU_shipping label
entry.content:
Hello @ST24 

Thank you for follow-up

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, there is no public print API to call HU-label printing. Timing is controlled by Output Management (OPD). To print after packing, not at HU creation, adjust your OPD rules for HU labels and, if needed, resend via Manage Output Items.

SAP Help: Useful official documentation.

Output Mgmt for Handling Unit Management (controls HU label timing). SAP Help Portal-Output Management for Handling Unit Management

Output Parameter Determination app (change conditions/timing). SAP Help Portal-Manage Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition-Output Parameter Determination

Manage Output Items app (reprocess/resend output). SAP Help Portal-Manage Output Items

KBA 3629010 – How to print HU labels from Warehouse Monitor (manual fallback path). SAP Support Portal-3629010 - Printing Handling Unit labels for Posting Change Documents in Warehouse Monitor App

KBA 3618070 – Limitation on mass HU printing in Warehouse Monitor (expectations). SAP Support Portal-3618070 - Unable to print handling units in mass in App Warehouse Monitor

External OMS through Print Queues (official event-driven release option).SAP Help Portal-Integrating SAP S/4HANA and External Output Systems

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: BTP Cloud Foundry trial - InsufficientResources - Ins...
entry.content:
Hey there, after trying everything, I finally tried this in my CAP Project and it worked for me, but it failed srv module once and worked at retry attempt 2.
Basically, I made the gen and mta files and redeployed. Below are the exact steps.
Hope this helps you guys: 
Before doing the following please note to copy UI Module if you don't know how to create it.
Then delete the mta.yaml and gen folder.
Then go to CLI:

  • cd <project namespace>
  • cds add hana
  • npm install
  • cds build --production (makes the gen folder)
  • cds add mta (makes mta.yaml)
  • cds add xsuaa (This adds the xsuaa to the mta.yaml), please check for the UI (app) module as well for fiori in mta.yaml.
  • npm install

Now, right click mta.yaml (build mta)

Then right-click mta_archives and click deploy  MTA ARCHIVE or type in CLI :

  • cd mta_archives
  • cf deploy <exact filename in mta_archives>
    Hope this helps.

entry.title: Re: Can we suspend interfaces by EventMesh?
entry.content:
Hello  

Thank you for your question

Have look at the blog: How to use SAP S/4HANA Event Enablement with SAP Cloud Platform (EN)

Yes, you can suspend interface event delivery safely without losing your data by temporarily pausing your subscription or consumer flow in the BTP integration Suite/Event Mesh instead of disabling event generation in the cloud.

Once you resume your subscription, Event Mesh will deliver all pending events to your consumers in FIFO order.

You cannot pause event creation from the cloud, but you can suspend delivery and processing by controlling the Event Mesh and Integration Suite.

Consult the following link for more details.

Create a Queue in the Event Mesh Instance

https://help.sap.com/docs/SAP_BUSINESSOBJECTS_BUSINESS_INTELLIGENCE_PLATFORM/a35562f321f74109b29008d25eb578de/ec9d46146fdb101497906a7cb0e91070.html?locale=en-US

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: How to apply filter for [specific criteria] in SAP (w...
entry.content:
Hello @nithin_pranesh 

The Manage Sales Inquiries app lacks Product in the filter bar, and in Public Cloud, you can only enable standard fields if SAP designates them as selection fields.

Supported solution

Build your own dataset (item-level) Create a Custom CDS View. Custom CDS Views design a CDS centred on the Inquiry Item to guarantee the Product is available. SAP Help-Custom CDS Views

Expose Product on the filter bar. Custom Analytical Queries create a query on top of your CDS; selection fields (incl. Product) appear in the query’s filter bar. SAP Help Portal-Custom Analytical Queries Define Custom Filters (Analytical Query)  how filters behave and are configured. SAP Help Portal-Define Custom Filters

If you truly need a brand-new attribute

Custom Fields & Logic ,create a custom field and enable it for Search/Filter where the app supports it. SAP Help Portal-    Extend and Integrate Your SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition

Summary:

You can not add a non-exposed standard field like Product to the delivered app’s filter bar. The supported path is, Custom CDS (item-level) → Custom Analytical Query, which gives you a report where Product is filterable. Use Custom Fields  only when the field does not exist at all.

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Currency Valuation Discrepancy on cleared Items
entry.content:
Hello @nbek 

Thank you for your question

Have a look at Advanced Foreign Currency Valuation

It is important to note that cleared item are still included in the valuation base for the valuation key date and this is the reason you experience that discrepancy. This happens even though the clearing posting have already neutralised exchange rate effects in accounting.

The FCV uses both the Open Item Management to valuate open FX items and Balance Valuation to valuate G/L balances.

If your cleared items remain in the valuation, they may count the exchange difference double. Meaning it will lead to mismatch in balances between trial and balance line item views.

Best regards

Chris

entry.title: Re: Field "Reference 1" in Upload Customer Open Items App.
entry.content:
Hello @Grzegorz_S 

Thank you for reaching out.

Your options and the limitations are correct.

The F4051 (Upload Customer Open Items) template only supports the delivered columns plus custom fields you create via Custom Fields and Logic; SAP’s standard “Reference 1” (XREF1_HD / Reference1InDocumentHeader) is not exposed for upload in that template. SAP Help Portal-Upload Customer Open Items

If you need to populate Reference 1 in bulk, the supported paths are:

Upload General Journal Entries (F2548) and map XREF1/XREF2/XREF3; if they don’t post, set them to Optional in SSCUI 102013 – Define Field Status Variants. SAP Support Portal-3578086 - When uploading Journal Entries through the app, the Upload General Journal Entries fields XREF1, XREF2, and XREF3 are not getting filled.

Post through the API (Journal Entry Post; change via Journal Entry Change) and include the header reference in the payload.SAP Help-APIs for General Ledger Accounting-Post Invoices with Payment Terms

Let me know if you need further information

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: Problem with PDF generation in SAP: address fields in...
entry.content:
Hello @Sonja_Trapp 

These SAP KBAs address this specific ADS rendering error:

KBA 3661092 — “ADS error invalid value for 'float' property.” Root cause and fix: field/binding typed as numeric but fed text; set the field to Text (string) or rebind to a string node. SAP Support Portal-3661092 - ADS error invalid value for 'float' property

KBA 3429684 — “ProcessingException: Invalid value: '' for 'float' property while previewing the form.” Same issue during preview; confirming that correcting the field type/format/binding resolves it. SAP Support Portal-3429684 - Error "ADS Render Failed [SYSTEM]ADS: com.adobe.ProcessingException: com.adobe.ProcessingException:: Invalid value: '' for 'float' property() " while previewing the form.

Useful for identifying an incorrect node:

KBA 2161416 — “How to check the XML file (XFD) in runtime.” Shows how to capture runtime XML to pinpoint the offending field. SAP Support Portal-2161416 - How to check the XML file (XFD) in runtime on PDF generation

Let me know if it helps

With regards

Chuma

entry.title: Re: OAuth 2.0 Client Type in S4HANA Cloud Public
entry.content:
Hello @KhaingZinTun 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, the screen is set to Public Client with Authorisation Code (PKCE), and switching to Client Credentials is not possible. SAP’s official documentation on PKCE public clients for inbound OAuth in Communication Systems/Arrangements confirms these fixed settings, with no option to change the grant type to Client Credentials.SAP Help Portal-Enabling Public OAuth Clients (PKCE) for Inbound Communication Scenarios

For server-to-server communication without user interaction, SAP’s recommended approach is to call S/4HANA Cloud through SAP BTP Destinations using OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion (or Basic/Client Certificate where applicable), rather than using Client Credentials within S/4HANA’s inbound user.SAP Community-OAuth2SAMLBearerAssertion Flow with the SAP BTP Destination Service. S/4HANA Cloud.

Let me know if you need further information

With best regards

Chuma

entry.title: Intelligent Supply Chains in Action: Fujitsu’s Agentic AI Approach to Global Trade Challenges
entry.content:
Introduction

Across industries, supply chain disruptions have become the new normal. Global manufacturers are navigating a complex web of challenges, including shifting trade policies, volatile energy prices, climate-driven events, and the growing demand for sustainable operations. The systems and strategies that once brought stability now struggle to keep up with this constant change.

According to a 2024 report by Maersk, 76% of respondents reported experiencing supply chain disruptions, and a startling 58% of them reported that the costs exceeded their predictions. From sudden tariff changes that reshape sourcing decisions to unexpected raw material shortages or port closures, disruptions no longer come one at a time as they overlap, compound, and evolve faster than traditional planning tools can respond.

In this environment, organisations need more than data visibility. They need decision intelligence systems that can sense change, learn continuously, and act responsibly in real time. This cannot be achieved in isolation, and an ecosystem or network play is a must. This is also where the latest innovations in Artificial Intelligence, like Agentic AI, can help redefine supply chain resilience.

The role of Agentic AI in Supply Chain Resilience

Agentic AI has the potential to power the next evolution of intelligent supply chain management. Instead of waiting for analysts or planners to interpret data, AI agents can continuously monitor supply, logistics, and market signals and then autonomously simulate and recommend the best response.

A few scenarios include:

  • Sudden geopolitical tensions? AI agents instantly recalculate costs, identify alternate suppliers, and propose optimised procurement mixes.
  • An energy-price surge? AI agents can suggest shifting production to lower-cost facilities or off-peak hours to protect margins and emissions goals.

SAP and its partner ecosystem are harnessing the power of Agentic AI to bring the vision of an intelligent supply chain to life. As a strategic SAP partner, Fujitsu is at the forefront of this innovation - creating next-generation solutions that enhance visibility, resilience, and responsiveness across global value networks.

Among the many factors disrupting supply chains today, cross-border tariffs remain one of the most complex and persistent challenges. In this article, we explore how Fujitsu’s Agentic AI-driven offerings are designed to help businesses anticipate, adapt to, and overcome these disruptions - enabling a smarter, more connected, and future-ready supply chain.

Building a Resilient Supply Chain to respond to Trade disruptions

In recent months, global trade dynamics have become increasingly unpredictable. The rules that once made it easy for goods to flow across borders - like free trade agreements - are now being challenged by new tariffs, shifting political alliances, and unexpected disruptions across the trade lanes. In a recent study published by BCG in 2025, it is estimated that at least 20% to 30% of EBIT margins for companies across all manufacturing sectors are at risk from higher tariffs!

Real-World Example: How Agentic AI Transformed a Global Electronics Manufacturer

A leading global electronics manufacturer in Asia faced significant challenges stemming from supply chain uncertainties, siloed enterprise systems and fragmented data. Their complex IT landscape made it difficult to access and interpret critical information across departments, slowing down decision-making during high-stakes disruptions.

Traditional point-to-point data integration approaches would have taken years to unify these disparate systems. Instead, the company sought a transformative solution - one that could consolidate enterprise data, enrich it with industry and business context, and dramatically accelerate decision cycles.

Agentic AI proved pivotal in transforming the company’s response to disruptions.

During disruptions such as trade tariffs or natural disasters like earthquakes, the manufacturer needed to rapidly assess the impact across their supply chain. This required synthesising internal enterprise data with external sources such as demographic trends, trade data, and harmonised system (HS) codes to simulate scenarios and take informed action.

As part of a broader digital transformation initiative, the company explored how Agentic AI could address supply chain shortages. By deploying intelligent agents across multiple systems - procurement, sales, inventory, and orchestration - they enabled real-time data access and contextual decision-making. These agents were trained to perform specialised tasks and provide actionable recommendations to business users.

For example, in the case of a raw material shortage, agents could evaluate multiple alternatives:

  • Sourcing from an alternative supplier,
  • Adjusting production schedules based on material availability, or
  • Engaging with customers to reschedule orders while maintaining service levels.

Each scenario required granular simulation across millions of SKUs, factoring in product, customer, and supplier contexts. The orchestrator agent played a pivotal role by assessing each option through the lens of cost, priority, and service level, ultimately recommending the most optimal path forward.

This innovative use of Agentic AI not only enhanced agility and collaboration across the enterprise but also earned a global recognition. The World Economic Forum’s AI Governance Alliance acknowledged this solution as one of 18 advanced AI applications transforming business worldwide.

Turning Data into Decisions

Expanding data visibility across enterprise, market, and regulatory sources enhances predictive accuracy and resilience.

Some other examples of how companies can use data and smart technologies to solve supply chain challenges encountered in tariff change scenarios are as follows:

  • Profit and Cost Analysis: By mapping out where costs are rising due to tariffs, companies can decide whether to pass those costs on to customers, absorb them, or find cheaper alternatives.
  • Pricing Simulations: Businesses can test how different prices will affect demand and profits in different tariff scenarios, helping them find the best balance between staying competitive and making money.
  • Operational Changes: If a key supplier is hit by a new tariff, companies can quickly see what other options are available, compare costs and quality, and make a switch if needed.

Fujitsu’s Multi-AI Orchestration Platform

Fujitsu has developed a Multi-AI agent orchestration platform for use cases such as Profit Margin & Cost Analysis that can leverage data stored in both SAP and non-SAP systems to present specific scenarios that can impact a customer’s supply chain. Using the simulation capabilities of this offering, multiple scenarios can be developed and compared, and the right strategy can be devised. The agentic AI platform leverages the data and helps to implement the decisions back into SAP applications like SAP S/4HANA SAP Integrated Business Planning and SAP Digital Manufacturing to effectuate the optimal plan chosen earlier. In the future, these agents could be extended to support SAP Business Network Supply Chain Collaboration and Supply Chain Orchestration as well.

These offerings are also complementary to the AI innovations delivered by SAP with the Business Suite e.g. seamless access with Joule, enhanced collaboration and decision making with SCM agents, etc.

Preparing for an AI-Enabled Future

Introducing technological capabilities isn’t enough. Companies also need to change the way they work with AI. This includes:

  • Cultivating an “AI-first” mindset: AI projects executed with a traditional mindset rarely deliver transformative outcomes. A transformational mindset is required to transform supply chains with AI. A few key aspects are as follows:
    • Myths like “AI will completely replace humans” are making way to “AI agents will work alongside humans”. But accepting this at an individual level requires humans to trust AI.
    • Especially within the supply chain, one cannot afford to have unreliable supply chain plans or manufacturing schedules. Balancing the level of AI autonomy with human empowerment is key to gaining this trust.
    • An AI-first and transformational mindset is required in transforming supply chains with AI
  • AI upskilling: Technologies such as Generative AI are being widely used by people to simplify their personal tasks. However, when it comes to corporate use of such tools, there are several nuances that we need to be aware of, like trusted tools, enterprise context and security concerns. These also apply specifically to the use of AI in supply chains
  • Improve Network relationships: A supply chain network includes partners like component suppliers, logistics partners etc. These partners are important to ensure optimal running of the supply chain in normal times and become critical during disruptions. Trusted data sharing, clear communication channels, and robust digital capabilities are critical to sustaining a resilient partner ecosystem

Conclusion

Agentic AI is redefining how organisations anticipate, adapt, and act amid global supply chain volatility. Fujitsu and SAP’s joint innovation demonstrates that the future of supply chain resilience lies not just in data, but in intelligent, autonomous collaboration.

Learn More

If you’d like to see how such technology can be turned into a solution in action or to learn more, consider attending the Fujitsu ActivateNow event in Singapore.

What did you think about this post? Please leave your feedback, thoughts, and suggestions in a comment below.

Also, please follow the co-authors: @RajeshMohan, @pavneetbedi and @naimul_islam42  so that you do not miss any future posts.

You may also be interested in the following blogs:

  • Driving Supply Chain Excellence with Business AI
  • Driving Resilience Through Intelligent Supply Chain Orchestration
  • Tariffs in Supply Chain Planning

entry.title: Set up depreciation areas in Asset Accounting in S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition with UPA
entry.content:
Purpose

In Universal Parallel Accounting (UPA), Asset Accounting (AA) has almost everything redesigned, from database tables to the user interfaces, from configurations, master data to depreciation calculation,  and from overall architecture to the technical implementation. 

The way to set up ledgers and depreciation areas is a part of those big changes. This article discusses how to set it up in Asset Accounting in S/4HANA Cloud Private Edition with UPA. It also describes a couple of common mistakes that can be easily made by users who are coming from the non-UPA.

Depreciation Areas in a Non-UPA System

Before UPA was introduced, it was a complex task to set up the depreciation areas in AA. Quite often, in a non-UPA system, you will see the following setup.

However, from an accountant point of view, this setup is confusing. For example, what kind of accounting principles can be called 'TAX' accounting principle? Which country is using an accounting principle called 'LOCAL'?

Ledgers and Accounting Principles in UPA

Concept

Accounting principles are rules to govern how companies record and report their financial data. The most famous accounting principles is International Financial Reporting Standards (IFRS) issued by the International Accounting Standards Board (IASB). In addition, there are local accounting principles, for example, the United States Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (US GAAP) or German Commercial Code (Handelsgesetzbuch, HGB).

Ledgers build the basis for reporting and financial statements in Accounting by storing related transaction data and journal entries. For this reason, all posting-relevant configuration settings for a company code, such as the accounting principles, currency settings, fiscal year variants (FYVs), and posting periods, must be linked to a specific ledger. 

Regardless UPA or non-UPA, it is always recommended to assign the leading ledger to the accounting principle of the corparate group, while in parallel, the non-leading ledgers for the local accounting principles.

In practice, there is a commonly made mistake: to create an accounting principle called 'LOCA' and assign ledgers to it. Perhaps the users may want to clone what they did in the past (non-UPA) into the UPA system. But this is wrong. You must not use a generic local accounting principle for all country and assign it to the local ledger. Always create a dedicated accounting principle per country. Below is an example to show you how to do it in UPA.

Set Up of Ledgers and Accounting Principles

The setup of ledger and accounting principle is done in the t-code FINSC_LEDGER. In order to make it easier to explain the concept, we start the example in an Excel file, with a flat the structure as shown in the screenshot below, then followed by the screenshots made in the system.

This example follows the SAP recommendation to manage the corporate valuation (e.g. IFRS) in the leading ledger 0L. In t-code FINSC_LEDGER, once you enter 'IFRS' at the ledger 0L, you will have it inheritted into all company codes that are assigned to 0L automatically. 

The ledger 2L is used for local accounting principles. So, leave 'Accounting Principle' as blank on ledger 2L. In all company codes that are assigned to 2L, enter the right accounting principles for those individual company codes.

In UPA, Asset Accounting  (AA) has a in-depth integration with General Ledger (G/L) Accounting. All currency types are set up in G/L and managed by G/L. You don't have to create a separate depreciation area for each currency type. 

With this fundamental setup in G/L, you can step into AA configurations. 

Depreciation Areas and Valuation Views in UPA

Concept

Depreciation areas in AA play the same role as ledgers do in G/L, but with a more fine-granular structure than a ledger.

'Valuation View' does not exist in AA with non-UPA. However, in UPA, this is one of the most important concepts. It is designed to map valuations in accordance with different valuation rules, for example, according to local commercial or tax laws, or according to international accounting principles. 

Valuation views can be pre-delivered (To learn more about it, see the Best Practice Content section under Miscellaneous Topics at the end of this article). But if you want to define your own valuation views, it is always recommended to define a dedicated valuation view per country. Do not resue them in a generic way.

Setup of Valuation Views

T-code FAACFG contains all configurations of AA. This artical mainly focuses on the configuration under the node 'Basic Settings for Valuation'.

It is recommended to define exact one valuation view for the corporate accounting principle, e.g. 0IFRS_0032 for IFRS below.

For each local accounting principle, create a set of valuation views for it. For example, 0DE_0001 and 0DE_0015 below for German accounting principle. The assignment is done in the configuration node 'Assign Valuation View to Accounting Principle'.  The property 'Posting in G/L', a.k.a. Posting Type, plays an important role in the posting. See the next chapter for more details.

Valuation views have properties to decide the rules for depreciation calculation and asset transactions. For example, both 0DE_0001 and 0DE_0015 have:

  • Net Book Value (NBV) set to '*'.
    This means negative NBV is allowed in the depreciation areas assigned to these valuation views.
  • Revaluation set to '*'.
    That means corresponding depreciation areas support revaluation. Those depreciation areas and the corresponding ledgers are selectable in Post Asset Revaluation app (or t-code ABAWL). ➡️ In another word, if you cannot select any ledger or deprecation area there, please check out the settings here in the corresponding valuation views. This is a commonly made mistake as well.

Setup of Depreciation Areas

Now it is the time to create depreciation areas for your company codes. Each depreciation area must be assigned to a valuation view, and thus linked to the corresponding ledger.

In UPA, it is a lot more easier to set up depreciation areas, once you have configured valuation views right. You don't have to create a separate depreciation area for every currency type. Since currency types are configured in G/L at ledger level, every depreciation area manages all currency types that are defined in the corresponding ledger. This is a significant improvement in UPA.

⚠️Important to know:

  • Since AA has a deep integration with G/L, it is not allowed to have a ledger defined in G/L but not used in AA. For example, if 2L is not used in AA, system will report an error message.
  • The property 'Posting in G/L' of valuation view 0DE_0001 is '1 - Area Posts in Real Time'. Therefore, for the depreciation area assigned to this valuation view (depreciation area 32), system save line items with the corresponding ledger, i.e. 2L, in this example.
  • The property 'Posting in G/L' of valuation view 0DE_0015 is '0 - Area Does Not Post'. Thus, line-items for the depreciation area 15 are saved with the technical ledger of 2L in ACDOCA. (You can find the ID of the techincal ledger in the database table FINS_TECH_LEDGER)

⚠️Something more about derived areas, a.k.a. virtual area in non-UPA.

  • In non-UPA, a virtual area, which is called 'Derived Area' in UPA now, can calculate values from areas belonging to different ledgers. This is not allowed anymore in UPA, where a derived area can only be built on depreciation areas from the same ledger.
  • In non-UPA, nothing from a virtual area is stored into database. Everything is calculated on-the-fly. However, in UPA, to make them accessible in Fiori analytics reports, AA designs it differently. If a derived area is included in an asset:
    1. This derived area is also stored in the asset master record.
    2. If 'Posting in G/L' in the corresponding valuation view is '0 - Area Does Not Post', line-items for this derived area are stored in the corresponding technical ledger in ACDOCA, . This is similar to what has been described in the last bullet-point of 'Important to know''.
    3. If 'Posting in G/L' is '4', line-items for this derived area are posted to the normal ledger. For example, in a France company code, ledger 2L is configured for local GAAP 'FRAP'. The line items for derived area 93 are posted to the ledger 2L, but not the corresponding technical ledger of 2L.

Is Everything Correct?

You are almost there. But how to know if everything has been set up correctly? AA has provided a nice tool for this purpose. That is the one being highlighted below.

It provides a lot of checks. For the configurations described in this article, just turn on the first option 'Basic Settings for Valuation'. This tool will tell you if there is still anything missing or wrong in the configuration.

Miscellaneous Topics

Group Valuation Ledger

To set up a dedicated ledger for group valuation in addition, create a ledger in FINSC_LEDGER (e.g. 4G), and choose '1 Group Valuation'  for it, as shown below.

Next, in the company codes that are assigned to 4G, enter the currency types that are defined for group valuation, e.g. 11, 31, etc. You should have defined these currency types in the node 'Currency Type' of FINSC_LEDGER, beforehand.

Best Practice Content

All the discussions in this article start with valuation views. How should those valuation views be created properly? Referring to the best practice content is the best way.

All configuration tables in AA have their best practice (default) content delivered by SAP in each release. You can choose which client should be used for those default content. After activating the best practice content, you will see all those default configuration in the client you have provided, including everything being mentioned in this article.

This is a separate topic and cannot be covered in this article. Please refer to this page for more details.

Summary

This article discusses about how to set up accounting principles, ledgers and depreciation areas in UPA, with basic examples.

It is also worth mentioning that AA groups depreciation keys by accounting principles. So corporate roll-out becomes easier than before. You may check out the relevant configuration in the node: FAACFG =>Basic Settings for Valuation=>Make Cross-Company Code FI-AA Settings per Accounting Principle.

entry.title: Migrating NowShortUrl of QR-Codes from old company to new company in FSM
entry.content:
There are NowShortUrl of QR-codes for equipment generated in old FSM company with SAP B1 as underlying ERP system, while a new FSM company was created from a new Data Base of SAP B1 system as a replacement to the old company. Full data backup & restore was not executed due to concern on synchronization issue of the new company, as the master data and field settings are not identical between the old and new data bases of underlying SAP B1 systems.

We want to reuse the NowShortUrl of QR-codes generated in the old FSM company and migrate them to the new FSM company, but selected data backup & restore for the NowShortUrl is not allowed from presently available Admin functions.

Is there any solution to migrate unpaired NowShortUrl of QR-Codes from old company to new company in FSM?

entry.title: Re: Fiori My Timesheet app default assignment
entry.content:
Hey Juan Carlos,

That's a great question, and I totally get why you're asking. It's a bit of a pain for users with multiple jobs to have to pick their assignment every single time they open an app. It should be smarter, right?

The short answer is that, unfortunately, there isn't a simple switch or setting you can flip to make one job the default. SAP designed it this way on purpose—kind of like a safety feature. They want to force users to consciously choose the right job so someone doesn't accidentally log their time or check a paystub for the wrong role.

But don't worry, you can definitely solve this and make life easier for your users!

 

The Best Way to Fix It (The Backend Trick) 

 

The most reliable way to handle this is with a bit of code on the backend using a BAdI. Think of a BAdI as an official "hook" that SAP leaves in its code, allowing developers like yours to add custom logic without messing up the original application.

For the My Timesheet app, the specific hook you're looking for is HCM_B_TIMESHEET_MAN_EXT

Here’s the game plan you can give to your ABAP developer:

  1. Implement the BAdI: They'll need to create an implementation for HCM_B_TIMESHEET_MAN_EXT.

  2. Define Your "Default" Logic: You'll need a way to tell the system which job should be the default. The most flexible way is to create a simple custom Z-table that just maps a user to their preferred PERNR. That way, you can easily change it later without touching the code.

  3. Re-order the List: Inside the BAdI, the developer can write a few lines of code to check your custom table (or whatever logic you decide on) and find the user's default PERNR. Then, they just re-arrange the list of jobs so that the default one is right at the top.

The magic here is that most Fiori apps automatically highlight the first item in the list. So, by putting the right job first, it will already be selected for the user when the pop-up appears. All they have to do is click "OK." It’s a simple trick that makes a big difference in the user experience!

 

The "Other" Way

There is another option, which involves customizing the app's user interface directly. A Fiori developer could write code to automatically select the default PERNR when the screen loads.

Honestly, I'd recommend avoiding this if you can. It's a bit more fragile because if SAP ever updates the My Timesheet app, your custom UI code could break. The backend BAdI method is much safer and more stable for the long haul.

The Bottom Line

So, to wrap it up:

  • No, there's no standard setting for this.

  • Yes, you can absolutely create a default programmatically.

  • The recommended path is to use the backend BAdI (HCM_B_TIMESHEET_MAN_EXT) to simply put the user's default job at the top of the selection list.

Hope this helps clear things up and gives you a solid path forward!

entry.title: Re: MRP Transfer Requirement Not Defaulting Source Storag...
entry.content:
Hey there,

You are so close! This is a classic SAP puzzle, and it feels like you're just one missing piece away from solving it.

The situation is that MRP is doing its job for Storage Location B. It sees the demand and correctly says, "Hey, we need to create a transfer!" But then it stops and asks, "...a transfer from where?" It doesn't know the source.

What you need to do is give MRP that missing piece of information. You need to create a special rule that essentially tells SAP: "Whenever Storage Location B needs this material, always go get it from Storage Location A."

Here’s the simple, two-step game plan to get it working.

 

Step 1: Create the "Rule" for the Transfer

 

First, you need to create this "go get it from A" rule. In SAP, this is called a Special Procurement Type.

  1. Hop into transaction OMD9.

  2. Create a new rule for your plant (you can name it something like Z1).

  3. Here are the important settings for your new rule:

    • Procurement Type: Set this to F (for External Procurement).

    • Special Procurement: Set this to U (for Stock Transfer).

    • Issuing storage location: This is the magic field! This is where you tell SAP the source. Put A in here.

Think of this as creating a permanent instruction in the system that says "Z1 means get it from Sloc A."

 

Step 2: Assign the Rule to Your Material

 

Now that you've created the rule, you just need to tell the material in Storage Location B to use it.

  1. Go to the material master using transaction MM02.

  2. Go into the MRP 4 view, but make sure you specify you're looking at the settings for Storage Location B. (You can do this by clicking the "Storage Location MRP" button at the top).

  3. Now, switch to the MRP 2 view (still for Sloc B!).

  4. Find the field Special Procurement Type and put your new rule (Z1) in there.

And That's It!

Now, when you run MRP, the whole process is automatic:

  1. MRP sees demand in Sloc B.

  2. It checks the material master for Sloc B and finds your new rule, Z1.

  3. The rule immediately tells MRP, "Aha! I need to create a stock transfer, and my source is Sloc A."

  4. It then creates the transfer requirement with Sloc A already filled in. No more manual work!

You've basically just connected the dots for MRP so it can complete the whole process on its own.

Hope this helps make it click! Let me know if you have any other questions.

entry.title: Re: Replicating material from a non-SAP system to the S/4...
entry.content:
Hey there,

First off, you're absolutely on the right track. Using that ProductMDMBulkReplicateRequest_In service is exactly how the pros handle this. You've got the right idea, and it's a very common project, so you're not alone in this!

Think of the whole process like setting up an automated, digital mailroom for new materials.

The Goal: A package (your material data) leaves the non-SAP system and arrives at your S/4HANA "mailroom." Instead of a person opening it, an automated robot checks it, approves it, and puts it on the shelf (activates it in the system) instantly.

Here’s how you build that automated mailroom.

 

1. Set Up the "Digital Loading Dock" (SOA Configuration)

 

Before anything can arrive, you need to open the door. This is a technical step where you go into a transaction called SOAMANAGER and activate the specific "loading dock" (ProductMDMBulkReplicateRequest_In) for your material data. This creates a unique web address (a WSDL) that you'll give to the team handling the non-SAP system, so they know exactly where to send the data packages.

 

2. The "Translator" in the Middle (Middleware)

 

Your non-SAP system speaks one language, and S/4HANA speaks another (a very specific XML format). You need a translator in the middle. This is almost always a middleware tool like SAP CPI (Cloud Platform Integration) or MuleSoft.

This tool's job is to:

  • Pick up the material data from the source system.

  • Map all the fields: "Customer Part Number" from the source becomes "MFRPN" in the XML, for example. This is usually the most time-consuming part of the project.

  • Package it all up perfectly into the required XML format and send it to the "loading dock" address you created in Step 1.

 

3. The "Autopilot" Button (MDG Workflow)

 

This is the fun part and the core of your question! How do we get the Change Request (CR) to create and approve itself?

You do this with a Rule-Based Workflow.

You'll create a special workflow just for these incoming materials. In that workflow, you'll set up a rule that says:

"IF this Change Request was created by our special 'integration user' (the one the middleware uses), THEN skip all the normal human approval steps and send it straight to the final check and activation."

This is the key. It creates a "fast lane" or an "autopilot" for trusted data coming from your other system, while any materials created manually by a person still go through the normal, multi-step approval process.

 

4. Adding Your "Special Instructions" (The BAdIs)

 

You were spot on to ask about BAdIs. These are your secret weapons for adding custom logic. Think of them as special instructions for the "mailroom robot."

The most important BAdI you'll use is USMD_RULE_SERVICE. You can tell it to do things like:

  • Derivations (Auto-filling blanks): "If the material type is 'FERT', then automatically set the purchasing group to '001'." This is for data that the source system doesn't have, but SAP needs.

  • Validations (Quality checks): "If the weight is missing, or the description is too short, stop the process and send an error alert." This ensures bad data never makes it into your system.

 

Your Game Plan Summarized:

 

  1. Map it Out: Get with the business and map every field from the old system to the new S/4HANA material master. This is your blueprint.

  2. Open the Door: Configure the service in SOAMANAGER.

  3. Build the Translator: Get your integration team to build the mapping logic in your middleware.

  4. Set Up the Autopilot: Create the special CR type and the rule-based workflow for the "fast lane" approval.

  5. Write Your Special Rules: Use the BAdI to code any extra derivations and quality checks you need.

It might seem like a lot of moving parts, but it's a very logical flow. You're essentially building a pipeline, and once it's set up, it's incredibly efficient.

You've got this! Hope this helps make the process a bit clearer.

entry.title: SAP PaPM Cloud Universal Model: What’s New as of 2025-10-10?
entry.content:
Hello SAP user community! Continue discovering the latest updates in SAP Profitability and Performance Management Cloud Universal Model (SAP PaPM Cloud UM) for Q4 2025, with enhancements designed to deliver a smoother and more seamless experience.

You can always stay up to date and explore past releases by following PaPMCloudUMWhatsNew .

Model

Data Screen: Embedded Association Links

Hierarchy levels in the Data screen now feature embedded association links to master data objects, allowing direct access without workflow interruption. 

For more information: Show Data

 

Data screen (Adapt UI): Customize Relation Sub-Grids

This update allows users to customize the display order of relation sub-grids on the Data screen. Using the drag and drop functionality, users can  personalize and organize related data more efficiently. Once reordered and saved via the Adapt UI feature, the new sub-grid arrangement is applied consistently  across all expanded data rows, improving workflow consistency and the overall user experience.

For more information: Adapt UI

 

Data Screen: Group level – Select, Delete and Copy

This update introduces group-level selection, deletion, and copying of records within editable tables, enabling bulk actions on entire groups to improve efficiency and reduce repetitive clicks. Users must expand a group before bulk actions become active, ensuring visibility of records to prevent unintended actions, for example, deleting all records under a specific functional area with a single action.

For more information: Application Help for Universal Model > Report Screen: Insert Show Element - Comments Pane and Data Screen:  Comments Pane

 

Model screen / Runtime Model screen: Search feature for Fields, Connections and Partitions

Previously, the Search feature was only available in the Functions tab. With this release, the Search feature has been extended to Fields, Connections, and Partitions tabs on both the Model screen and Show Runtime Model screens.

As you enter a search term, the system instantly filters the rows and displays only the rows whose ID or description contains below the search field

To make navigation easier, the results are categorized into “Modeling” fields and “Palette” icons, ensuring quick access to the most relevant items.

For more information: Application Help for Universal Model > Model Screen

 

 

Model View / View: Aggregation supports Data-Type Characteristics

Model View and View functions have been enhanced to support aggregation of type “Count”  on Characteristic field of type “Date”. The previous restriction requiring the input and output fields of Aggregation of type “Count” to be of the same type has been removed, providing greater flexibility in data modeling.

This update allows COUNT to be applied to characteristic fields, including dates, with outputs assignable to either numeric Key Figures (such as tiny int, small int, integer, large int, double, or decimal) or Characteristics (String),

While enforcing validation to ensure output fields are of appropriate numeric or string types, thereby improving data modeling flexibility and consistency.

For more information: Application Help for Universal Model > Model View: Aggregation and View: Aggregation

 

Process

Runtime Functions: Total Disk Size of All Table Parts (Bytes) 

A new field called Total Disk Size of All Table Parts (Bytes) is now available in the Display Runtime Functions application  under the Technical Information section, which displays the total disk space used by each runtime function.  This allows users to see how much space their data is using and helps keep track of resource consumption. 

For more information: Application Help for Universal Model > Display Runtime Functions

We hope you enjoy exploring these new features and continue to maximize the value of SAP PaPM Cloud UM.

Stay tuned—more enhancements are on the way!

entry.title: Re: SAP BTP CI CD service for on premise S4 HANA systems...
entry.content:
Dear Sunil,

as you already pointed out, the Continuous Integration and Delivery (CI/CD) Service does not support on-premises or private cloud deployment scenarios. You need to setup your own Jenkins (or other CI server) to host a pipeline using gCTS, see Set up a Pipeline-Based ABAP Development and Testing Process Using Git-Enabled Change and Transport System - Project "Piper": Continuous Delivery for the SAP Ecosystem

HTH,

Christoph

entry.title: Intercompany individual purchase order scenario
entry.content:
We have the following scenario

Plant 1710 under CC 1710

Plant 1720 under CC 1720

Customer places an order with plant 1710, this inturn creates a requsition to transfer goods from 1720 to 1710 to ship to the customer. The requisition is converted to a intercompany STO but the delivery creation fails because the delivery is looking into sales order stock instead of the available stock. This scenario can work for MTO but for MTS we need to issue stock from inventory. How can we dictate the availability check for STO delivery creation for a STO created against sales order to look into unrestricted inventory instead of sales order stock.
